skill.name: expo-dev-client
skill.description: Build and distribute Expo development clients locally or via TestFlight for testing custom native code changes on physical devices.
skill.summary: Build and distribute Expo development clients for testing
skill.author: expo

security_audit.summary: All 38 static findings are false positives. External command detections are legitimate Expo/EAS CLI commands for development workflows. No malicious patterns, credential exfiltration, or security risks identified. The skill contains only documentation for standard build commands.

content.user_title: Build Expo development clients for testing
content.value_statement: Testing apps with custom native code requires a development client. This skill provides step-by-step commands to build development clients locally or via TestFlight for physical device testing.
actual_capabilities: Generate EAS Build configuration for development clients
Build iOS and Android development clients for TestFlight
Build development clients locally on developer machines
Install built clients on simulators and physical devices
Connect dev clients to local Metro bundlers
limitations: Does not handle Apple Developer program enrollment or certificates
Cannot fix network or infrastructure issues on EAS servers
Does not modify app source code or native modules
Requires existing Expo project with Expo CLI configured

use_cases.title: Create custom Expo Go for testing native modules
use_cases.description: Developers building apps with custom native code need a development client to test on physical devices instead of Expo Go.
use_cases.target_user: Expo developers using custom native modules

use_cases.title: Distribute test builds via TestFlight
use_cases.description: Send development client builds to testers through TestFlight for beta testing on real iOS devices.

use_cases.title: Build and install locally for rapid iteration
use_cases.description: Build development clients locally for immediate testing without cloud build queues during active development.

prompt_templates.title: Basic development client setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set up EAS Build with a development profile for creating an Expo development client. My project already has eas.json but I need to add the development configuration.

prompt_templates.title: Build for TestFlight
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an iOS development client and submit it to TestFlight for my team to test. Use the development profile.

prompt_templates.title: Build and install locally
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a development client locally for iOS simulator and show me how to install it on the booted simulator.

prompt_templates.title: Troubleshoot build issues
prompt_templates.prompt: My development client build is failing with signing errors. Help me diagnose and fix the issue using eas credentials.

output_examples.input: Build an iOS development client and submit to TestFlight
output: Step 1: Configure eas.json with development profile
Step 2: Run: eas build -p ios --profile development --submit
Step 3: Wait for build completion email from Apple
Step 4: Download from TestFlight and install on device
Step 5: Launch app and connect to Metro bundler
Install on simulator: xcrun simctl install booted ./path/to/App.app
Launch simulator: xcrun simctl boot booted

best_practices: Use Expo Go for initial development before creating a dev client
Configure eas.json with autoIncrement for version management
Test locally first before submitting to TestFlight for team testing
anti_patterns: Creating dev clients for apps that work in Expo Go
Not clearing cache when builds fail repeatedly

faq.question: When do I need a development client?
faq.answer: You need a development client when your app requires custom native code that Expo Go does not support, such as local Expo modules, Apple targets, or third-party native modules.

faq.question: Can I use this for production builds?
faq.answer: No. Development clients are for testing only. Use standard EAS Build profiles for production App Store submissions.

faq.question: How long does a TestFlight build take?
faq.answer: iOS development builds typically take 10-20 minutes on EAS Build depending on queue size and project complexity.

faq.question: Do I need Apple Developer account?
faq.answer: Yes. Building for physical devices or TestFlight requires an Apple Developer account. Simulator builds do not require signing.

faq.question: How do I connect to my local development server?
faq.answer: Start Metro with npx expo start --dev-client, then scan the QR code in the dev client or enter the URL manually.

faq.question: What is the difference between local and cloud builds?
faq.answer: Local builds run on your machine using Xcode/Android Studio. Cloud builds run on EAS infrastructure. Local builds are faster for iteration; cloud builds work on any machine.
